name: Kulfi
history: Kulfi is a popular frozen dairy dessert originating from the Indian subcontinent. It is traditionally prepared by evaporating sweetened and flavored milk via slow cooking, with a distinctive creamy texture.
description: Kulfi is a creamy, dense frozen dessert made with milk, flavored with cardamom, and often contains chopped nuts. It's richer and creamier than typical ice cream and is set in molds to freeze.

instructions.title: Reduce the Milk
instructions.description: Pour the milk into a heavy-bottomed pan and bring it to a boil. Simmer over low heat, stirring regularly, until the milk reduces to one-third of its original volume.

instructions.title: Add Flavorings
instructions.description: Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands to the reduced milk. Stir well until the sugar is dissolved.

instructions.title: Add Nuts
instructions.description: Add the chopped nuts to the mixture and mix well.

instructions.title: Set the Kulfi
instructions.description: Pour the mixture into kulfi molds or small cups. Cover and freeze until set, usually 6-8 hours or overnight.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Once set, unmold the kulfi by running warm water over the molds. Serve immediately.

tips: Ensure continuous stirring while boiling milk to avoid burning.
Kulfi takes longer to melt than regular ice cream due to its density.
variations: Mango Kulfi: Add mango puree for a fruity flavor.
Rose Kulfi: Incorporate rose water and pink food coloring for a floral variant.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored in the freezer for up to 1 month.
storage.instructions: Store in airtight kulfi molds or wrapped in cling film.

presentationTips: Garnish with additional chopped nuts and saffron strands.
Serve on a plate with some fresh fruits.
